meanings.definition: The act of guiding a ship or aircraft.
meanings.sent1: During the pilotings of the ship, the captain carefully steered through the storm.
meanings.sent2: The pilotings of the aircraft were smooth and precise, ensuring a safe landing.
meanings.sent3: The pilotings of the ship were so expertly done that even the seagulls were impressed.
meanings.sent4: Her skillful pilotings of the aircraft were like a dance in the sky.
meanings.sent5: The pilotings of the ship in the treacherous waters will be remembered for years to come.

meanings.definition: The process of testing or trying out new methods or ideas.
meanings.sent1: The pilotings of new strategies in the business were successful and increased profits.
meanings.sent2: Scientists often engage in pilotings to discover innovative solutions to problems.
meanings.sent3: The pilotings of the new recipe resulted in a delicious dish that everyone loved.
meanings.sent4: Her pilotings of different study techniques helped her find the most effective way to learn.
meanings.sent5: The pilotings of the new technology led to groundbreaking advancements in the field.

meanings.definition: The act of leading or directing a group or project.
meanings.sent1: His pilotings of the team were inspiring, motivating everyone to work harder.
meanings.sent2: The successful completion of the project was attributed to her excellent pilotings.
meanings.sent3: The pilotings of the school play made it a huge success, with everyone applauding.
meanings.sent4: Her pilotings of the charity event were so effective that they raised double the expected funds.
meanings.sent5: The pilotings of the group discussion ensured that all voices were heard and considered.
